‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚ú® (3.5/5)

Mama Shelter Lille is a vibrant and lively hotel that really captures the fun, playful spirit the brand is known for. The XXL room we stayed in was impressively spacious ‚Äî stylishly designed with modern touches, cozy bedding, and plenty of room to relax. The location is another huge plus, perfectly situated near the train station and the city center, making it easy to explore Lille on foot. The breakfast was also a highlight ‚Äî fresh, plentiful, and full of variety, from pastries and fruit to hot dishes and great coffee.

However, while the overall atmosphere was enjoyable, a few key issues made the stay less comfortable than it could have been. When the room experienced a blackout and power trip, the recovery process was disappointingly slow. It took quite some time before the issue was addressed, largely because there didn‚Äôt seem to be any technical staff on-site to handle it promptly. This was frustrating, especially given the level of service one would expect from a well-known hotel brand.

The air conditioning was another letdown. It barely seemed to work, leaving the room uncomfortably warm and stuffy, particularly during the night. Even with the windows open, there wasn‚Äôt enough ventilation to cool the space down properly, which made sleeping difficult.

Overall, Mama Shelter Lille has the potential to be an excellent stay ‚Äî the design is modern and fun, the food is great, and the location couldn‚Äôt be better. But the lack of technical support and weak air conditioning really affected the comfort level. With a bit more attention to maintenance and faster problem-solving, it could easily go from good to great. As it stands, it‚Äôs a stylish and convenient hotel with charm ‚Äî but one that still needs a bit more substance behind the style
Amazing stay from start to finish, from the parking, to the rooftop bar! The food in the restaurant was amazing, room was incredible, and super dog friendly, would highly recommend!

I stayed at Mama Shelter Luxembourg and while the hotel has its perks, there were a few things that left me disappointed. First, I was surprised to find no slippers in the room, which is typically a standard offering at most hotels. When I asked about it, the response was ‚Äúplease buy it,‚Äù which felt a bit off for a hotel of this caliber.

The room itself was clean and well-maintained, which I appreciated. However, I would have liked to see complimentary bottled water in the room, as well as a liquid soap dispenser rather than the solid soap provided (including shampoo). It was a bit inconvenient for showering.

On a positive note, the breakfast was fantastic! It was definitely the highlight of my stay ‚Äì great selection, fresh, and tasty.

Overall, while the breakfast was excellent and the room was nice, I think Mama Shelter Luxembourg could improve in terms of amenities and customer service for a more complete guest experience.

It wasn‚Äôt a pleasant stay overall . I noticed the broken tap at the bathroom as a first thing and I informed the reception. I was told that someone will come to fix it the next day but no one came. My hand was touching to the sink and dirty water at some point while washing my hands. There were flies in the room even though I didn‚Äôt open the window. The last day I saw a bug in the toilet. The toilet paper holder was loose. I went to the rooftop and ordered Roast-beef but they didn‚Äôt tell me there are 2; one with the hash-brown  and tomatoes and the other one is simple. So they brought the expensive one which was 10 Euro more. Also they charge you extra during the check in and they deduct from this amount when you consume food and drinks that was a bit confusing and unnecessary makes it hard to track. The rooftop was nice. Second time at this hotel for a business trip. The beds are comfortable but the rooms are either too hot or too noisy.  Apart from one little carton on arrival, no water provided. No coffee / kettle in the room. (Tip: Buy a big bottle from the supermarket and put it in the fridge).

Breakfast is a bit disappointing for the price. (Tip: Go to one of the cafes nearby instead).

The bar can be very loud and getting served takes a while, but the decor and surroundings is very nice.

Both times the roof terrace has been closed.

The staff is always very good. Always nice to see the same, friendly faces.

Having stayed in a few other Lisbon hotels, I would take Mama Shelter but it's not the Mama experience of other cities.

Mama Shelter Lille is a vibrant and lively hotel that really captures the fun, playful spirit the brand is known for. The XXL room we stayed in was impressively spacious ‚Äî stylishly designed with modern touches, cozy bedding, and plenty of room to relax. The location is another huge plus, perfectly situated near the train station and the city center, making it easy to explore Lille on foot. The breakfast was also a highlight ‚Äî fresh, plentiful, and full of variety, from pastries and fruit to hot dishes and great coffee.

However, while the overall atmosphere was enjoyable, a few key issues made the stay less comfortable than it could have been. When the room experienced a blackout and power trip, the recovery process was disappointingly slow. It took quite some time before the issue was addressed, largely because there didn‚Äôt seem to be any technical staff on-site to handle it promptly. This was frustrating, especially given the level of service one would expect from a well-known hotel brand.

The air conditioning was another letdown. It barely seemed to work, leaving the room uncomfortably warm and stuffy, particularly during the night. Even with the windows open, there wasn‚Äôt enough ventilation to cool the space down properly, which made sleeping difficult.

Overall, Mama Shelter Lille has the potential to be an excellent stay ‚Äî the design is modern and fun, the food is great, and the location couldn‚Äôt be better. But the lack of technical support and weak air conditioning really affected the comfort level. With a bit more attention to maintenance and faster problem-solving, it could easily go from good to great. As it stands, it‚Äôs a stylish and convenient hotel with charm ‚Äî but one that still needs a bit more substance behind the style
